meanings.definition: A lively dance in triple time.

meanings.sent2: At the wedding, everyone joined in the traditional jigs to celebrate.
meanings.sent3: The jigs at the party were so fun that even the shyest guests couldn't resist dancing.

meanings.sent5: The music filled the room, and the jigs brought smiles to everyone's faces.

meanings.sent2: The mechanic relied on the jigs to keep the metal pieces steady during work.
meanings.sent3: The jigs made the workshop look like a puzzle of tools and gadgets.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the jigs was crucial for the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the jigs, the work became easier and more accurate.

meanings.definition: A type of fishing lure with a single hook.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman attached the jigs to his line to attract the big catch.
meanings.sent2: The shiny jigs in the water caught the attention of the hungry fish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull mistook the jigs for a tasty snack and tried to grab it.
meanings.sent4: The jigs danced in the water, tempting the fish with their sparkle.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman's favorite jigs never failed to entice the fish in the lake.
